channel.title: Russia on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Russia on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: The Mysterious Shortwave Radio Station Stoking US-Russia Nuclear Fears
item.description: A popular shortwave Russian radio station dubbed “UVB-76” has been an enigma for decades. But its recent messages have turned it into a tool for Kremlin saber-rattling.

item.title: The Mysterious Shortwave Radio Station Stoking US-Russia Nuclear Fears
item.description: A popular shortwave Russian radio station dubbed “UVB-76” has been an enigma for decades. But its recent messages have turned it into a tool for Kremlin saber-rattling.

item.title: The First Federal Cybersecurity Disaster of Trump 2.0 Has Arrived
item.description: The breach of the US Courts records system came to light more than a month after the attack was discovered. Details about what was exposed—and who’s responsible—remain unclear.

item.title: The First Federal Cybersecurity Disaster of Trump 2.0 Has Arrived
item.description: The breach of the US Courts records system came to light more than a month after the attack was discovered. Details about what was exposed—and who’s responsible—remain unclear.

item.title: Ex-NSA Chief Paul Nakasone Has a Warning for the Tech World
item.description: At the Defcon security conference in Las Vegas on Friday, Nakasone tried to thread the needle in a politically fraught moment while hinting at major changes for the tech community around the corner.

item.title: Ex-NSA Chief Paul Nakasone Has a Warning for the Tech World
item.description: At the Defcon security conference in Las Vegas on Friday, Nakasone tried to thread the needle in a politically fraught moment while hinting at major changes for the tech community around the corner.

item.title: The curious case of Russia’s charm offensive with NASA this week
item.description: “We’re going to continue to work on the problems that we have here.”

item.title: Microsoft catches Russian hackers targeting foreign embassies
item.description: End goal is the installation of a malicious TLS root certificate for use in intel gathering.

item.title: The Kremlin's Most Devious Hacking Group Is Using Russian ISPs to Plant Spyware
item.description: The FSB cyberespionage group known as Turla seems to have used its control of Russia’s network infrastructure to meddle with web traffic and trick diplomats into infecting their computers.

item.title: The Kremlin's Most Devious Hacking Group Is Using Russian ISPs to Plant Spyware
item.description: The FSB cyberespionage group known as Turla seems to have used its control of Russia’s network infrastructure to meddle with web traffic and trick diplomats into infecting their computers.

item.title: Pro-Ukrainian hackers take credit for attack that snarls Russian flight travel
item.description: State-owned Aeroflot cancels dozens of flights, stranding travelers throughout Russia.

item.title: Ars spoke with the military’s chief orbital traffic cop—here’s what we learned
item.description: “We have some 2,000 or 2,200 objects that I call the ‘red order of battle.’”

item.title: Rocket Report: SpaceX to make its own propellant; China’s largest launch pad
item.description: United Launch Alliance begins stacking its third Vulcan rocket for the second time.

item.title: It’s hunting season in orbit as Russia’s killer satellites mystify skywatchers
item.description: “Once more, we play our dangerous game—a game of chess—against our old adversary.”
